runs.comm: fires it full but this was heading down the leg side, raps the batsman on the pads
gets some away movement from the pitch but Masakadza defends it off the back foot
he comes forward to the length ball and punches it straight to mid-off
slightly back of length, it's dragged towards mid-on with a mistimed shot and the batsmen take the first runs. Mohammad Sami gets his hands on the ball
back of length delivery on off, Sibanda comes forward and defends it solidly to off
he stays on the back foot and dabs the back of length delivery to the off side.
that's the first boundary of the day. It was short and rising outside off, the batsman gets some width with the away movement, hops and punches this through backward point
stands tall and hammers the back of length delivery with a swat! This isn't timed properly but clears mid-on with ease
he pushes the length delivery towards mid-on and charges down, could have been close had the fielder - Wahab - hit
beats the batsman with one that bounces a touch extra! Sibanda chases the delivery and looks to cut it through point but the ball flies above the bat
leans forward and steers the length delivery to third man for a single
now Masakadza picks up a single to third man with a neat steer
slides this one on the pads and the batsman looks to flick it over square leg but doesn't connect. It hits the pads and rolls towards midwicket
he stays in the crease and punches the length ball firmly to the off, can't beat the cover fielder
it's only marginally short of length but Sibanda was always looking to pull. Doesn't get the timing though and a diving midwicket keeps the batsmen to a single
he gets down on his knee early and laps the length delivery over his left shoulder for another boundary. The fine leg was in the circle and he played it fine enough to comfortably beat the man
comes down the pitch this time, ends up making that full delivery a yorker but digs it out towards cover
rolls his finger on this delivery, but this is slightly leg-sidish and short enough for the batsman to drag it through backward square leg for another boundary
short of length and pacy too, the batsman was looking to clip it to the leg side but can only defend it down the pitch
pushes this length delivery towards mid-on and scampers through for another quick single
it's defended towards point but Shehzad makes a simple mistake to allow a single, doesn't get down in time

there is a collision between the batsman and the bowler! Sibanda punches the fuller delivery to mid-off and charges down the pitch for a single. Bhatti was looking to back-up Afridi's throw but runs into the path of Sibanda. All the Pakistan players run in to check if everyone's alright
that's some timing! Masakadza waits in the crease and swivels to whack this back of length delivery over square leg. It looked like a chip but the ball clears the boundary
that was in the air for a long time! The batsman looks to upper cut as the third-man was in the circle, but gets more height than distance. Malik runs backwards from point but cannot make it in time
back of length and around off stump, the batsman waits on the back foot and defends it down the pitch

has that hit the batsman on his helmet! Masakadza went down on his knee to play the lap sweep, but that is a brave shot to attempt against Wahab. He gets smacked on the grill of the helmet as the bowler is too quick. All good. He is ready to face the next one
short delivery rising chest high, the batsman gets a bit cramped as he looks to pull, drags it to midwicket
short delivery but this is way down the leg side
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman clips it in front of square with a lot of time. Hafeez runs in from deep square leg and slides to make the save, but he was touching the ropes

superb slower delivery but what adjustment from Masakadza! He was making room to go inside out, but spots the slower one, then steers it through where first slip should have been. Third man had no chance
waits on the back foot and dabs it behind point for a single to keep the strike
that's a poor line. It's on the pads and is easily clipped through backward square leg for yet another boundary
full and on the pads, a touch slower too, this time he whips it but finds the man at deep square leg
he comes forward to drive the length delivery on the tup, the fielder at cover, Hafeez, makes a diving stop but cannot prevent a single

short delivery, a touch slower too. The batsman mistimes his pull towards midwicket and takes off for a single, but a direct hit at the non-striker's end could be trouble for him. That was good work from the fielder, who had to swivel and fire a throw behind him, but the batsman has just made it back in time
that's short and wide and that has been handsomely cut away through backward point. That was right of the middle and the fielder at point had no chance. That's 50 for Zimbabwe
whoo! That was close. Sibanda was nowhere in the frame at the non-striker's end. A foolish run really. He pushed it straight to cover and pressed on.
superb shot! Sami is not as quick as Bhatti or Wahab, so the batsman takes a comfortable forward stride and punches the length delivery firmly to deep cover
comes forward and punches the length delivery to mid-off
comes forward and punches this to long-on for a single
clips this back of length delivery through midwicket and there is a couple as the fielder in the deep is rather square

it's all over! Sami gets his first international wicket in ages. Sibanda looks to pull a short delivery from outside off but gets beaten by the extra pace. That got big on the batsman and he ends up top-edging it behind the stumps. Sarfraz runs towards the edge of the circle and takes a good catch over his shoulder

make it two in two! Sami is on a hat-trick. Masakadza played a loose push on this back of length delivery and it was the extra pace that did the trick again. It catches the inside edge and ricochets on to the stumps. The umpires want to check for the no-ball - this was just as close as the last delivery - but he is fine.
that's a yorker first up! Coventry digs it out towards off
flatter and turns away a touch. The batsman dabs it to short third man and calls for a quick single
comes forward and punches this flighted delivery firmly to long-off
a premeditated shot brings Coventry four! He goes down on his knee early for a paddle sweep and is lucky to get some bat on it. That runs quickly to the fine-leg boundary
that's a cracking shot! He lunges forward and carves this flighted delivery inside out over cover. No chance for the man in the deep
on the middle-stump line, the batsman punches it to long-on for a single

What a shot that one! He arches his back and punches this back of length delivery beautifully over cover. The man at deep cover runs in and had it covered but slips and allows this one to run to the boundary

there goes the third one! Coventry is not happy but Pakistan are ecstatic. That was a nasty short ball, a bit down the leg side, but it caught Coventry in an awkward position, trying to evade it while hanging his bat. Sarfraz takes it asks the question immediately. Wahab is celebrating too. Can't be sure if there was anything on that: it's so loud. The replays show it missed the bat and just flicked the shoulder. A bit unfortunate for the batsman there
short delivery but this is well down the leg side
back of length on off stump, the batsman defends it to the off side
another one right on the off stump line, the batsman defends it to off side
looks to pull this from well outside off, but that is a quick short one from Wahab. The batsman makes no contact
gets on top of this short delivery and steers it with soft hands towards third-man, runs the first one hard and calls for the second one. That's superb running
tossed up on off, the batsman looks to drive it through off but gets an inside edge to short fine leg
comes forward and eases the flighted delivery through covers for a single to the deep
shorter this time! That's some timing from Chigumbura.. he waits on the back foot and chops it away through backward point. It beats the man in the circle, then beats the deep cover
how did that miss the stumps! That was pretty close to off. The batsman played for the spin but this slides in between the bat and the pad
comes forward and pushes it to point for a quick single
looks to flick a fuller delivery but mistimes it back down the pitch
flatter and on the pads from round the wicket, the batsman flicks it to short fine leg
flatter on the middle and leg line, clipped away through square leg for a single
comes down the pitch and chips this inside out over the cover fielder for a single to the deep
sweeps this firmly to deep midwicket
looks to sweep but misses. Appeal for lbw but that pitches outside leg
missed stumping! The batsman charges down the pitch and looks to hoick it over midwicket but plays all around it. Sarfraz is just beaten by the bounce there
superb reverse-sweep there! He goes down early and gets a solid connection to power that behind point
comes forward and punches it through midwicket for a couple
comes down the pitch and punches the tossed up delivery to long on
he waits on the back foot and pushes it towards cover for a quick single
comes down the pitch and punches this to wide long-on for another couple
second missed stumping! Williams is way down the pitch, misses the googly, and Sarfraz just palms it away. Simple chance missed there. Waqar Younis can't believe it
flatter and wider outside off, the batsman waits and runs it down to third man
comes down the pitch and chips the flatter delivery over cover for a single
shorter and on the leg side, the batsman pulls it down to deep backward square leg. That brings up the team's 100
Malik strikes! Williams looks to sweep this tossed up delivery but gets a thick top edge that lobs up for Wahab at short-fine leg. Easy catch there.
slower this time and on the middle stump line, Raza defends it to the leg side
waits on the back foot and plays a late cut, but straight to short third man
short outside off but Chigumbura flat bats it over square leg, not in control there, but that falls well short of the man in the deep
on the pads, the batsman clips it straight to midwicket
gets off the mark with an inside edge past the stumps! He was looking to push this back of the length delivery towards off
superbly driven! This is full on off and Chigumbura not only puts power behind that but also gets a lot of timing to thread the tiny gap between extra cover and mid-off
short outside off, it's slightly slower too, the batsman pulls it behind square for a single to the deep
he stays on the back foot and punches it to long-on for a single
waits on the back foot and punches it to deep cover
he looks to flick the flighted delivery to the leg side but misses it, it hits the pads and rolls towards point
waits on the back foot and nudges it with the turn through square leg
good work by Umar Akmal at midwicket to prevent a certain boundary! The batsman charged down the pitch and hit that firmly, but Akmal gets a hand to that
now Raza comes down, punches it down to long on
tossed up on off stump, Chigumbura punches it firmly to long on
he gets beaten by the slower ball but gets four for that! He went for a pull, was a bit too early on the shot, gets a top edge which flies fine on the leg side and beats the fielder
looks to punch the fuller delivery through cover but gets a thick outside edge to third man
waits on the back foot and punches it over cover for a single
slower bouncer again, this one is outside off. The batsman looks to cut it to third man but makes no connection. The leg umpire raises his arm to call it a no-ball for height
picks up another boundary with a sliced shot over point! That was full and well outside off, Chigumbura went after that and got the placement right
that's a superb yorker but even that runs to the boundary as Chigumbura gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
fuller and that's punched firmly, but straight to mid-off
fires a superb yorker on off stump, the batsman somehow keeps it out and prevents the hat-trick
another one right on the blockhole, not much that the batsman can do with it. Dug out towards cover
another yorker, the batsman pushes it to long-off for a single
that's a spanking shot over midwicket! He was on the back foot, gets the back of length delivery, and that is swatted with some power over the cow corner
fires a yorker wide outside off, just inside the marker but the umpire calls it a wide. Harsh call that one
he errs in the length this time. It's a half-volley and Raza carves it over extra cover for yet another boundary
misses the yorker, it's a low full-toss but Raza slaps it straight to long-on. He was looking good there, but Raza has to go
bowls it full and bowls it well wide of off, easy call for the umpire
that was a quick yorker, slightly misses his line as this is just outside leg stump. The umpire calls it a wide
full and fast on off stump, the batsman slices it to deep cover for a single
back of length on the pads, the batsman looks to clip it fine on the leg side but it rolls off the thigh pad
makes room and slices the fuller delivery behind point. Bhatti, in the deep, had it covered but lets it through his fingers. Poor effort in the deep
gets his front leg out of the way and smashes the length delivery through midwicket. He was expecting the length and gets it. A risky shot, but it comes off this time
full outside off, now Bhatti has to run to his right but he is not going to stop it as this is beautifully timed. That races to the extra-cover boundary. That's the first hat-trick of this game
he keeps the strike with a steer to third man
bowls it full and wide outside off, the batsman cannot connect. The umpire is ok with it as well
oh what a flick that is! Chigumbura reaches his half-century with a powerful flick! It's a full toss on the pads but that is flicked with some power.. Flies deep into the stands at long leg
gets his yorker right, the batsman digs it out towards deep point for a single
slower bouncer, the batsman looks to cut but misses
looks to cut but misses again! This one was on back of length and bowled at pace
back of length outside off, steered down to third man for a single
back of length and on the stumps, the batsman nudges it to off and brings Chigumbura back on strike
the angle does the job! It's full and fast, Chigumbura looks to hit across the line and misses. The middle stump takes a beating
length delivery on the pads, flicked to deep square leg for a single
slower delivery on the pads, the batsman clips it down to fine leg for a single

what a clanger! That is the dolliest of dollies and Wahab cannot complain because it's him. The batsman looked to hit across the line, got a thick top edge, Wahab got under it but lets it bounce off his palms
punched to point for a single off the back foot.
